basics.name: Grace Madson
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Electrical Engineering at the University of Minnesota Twin Cities with minors in Computer Science and German. I am doing an exchange semester at the University of Hawaii at Manoa for Spring 2024. I expect to graduate in the Spring of 2025.

education.institution: University of Minnesota - Twin Cities, Minneapolis, MN

work.company: Institute on the Environment University of Minnesota
work.summary: Assistant for Director of International Partnerships, Sabine Engel, at the University of Minnesota
highlights: Organized and facilitated events with international business and political leaders
Designed brochures and flyers, and documented meeting agendas using Word and InDesign weekly
Communicated with partners, businesses, and university staff and students daily through phone calls and emails
Moderated international Zoom meetings with 75+ participants by greeting attendees, answering questions, creating breakout rooms, presenting slide decks, and sharing informative documents
Advocated for opportunities for students to get involved with the energy transition by speaking at lectures and administering the study abroad program Germany: Leading the Renewables Revolution
Edited and created websites with Wix for university programs and organizations

work.summary: Worked on various projects for Airgain including power testing the Asset Tracker product line, circuit and schematic design, and customer support debugging
highlights: Created and executed test fixtures to conduct power testing on the entire product line of Asset Trackers while generating training documentation
Created footprints, symbols, and schematics using Altium
Used tools such as multimeters, oscilloscopes, and terminal emulators to find solutions to technical problems
Assisted in debugging existing PCB boards for RMA using soldering techniques
Designed a test board for a new product comprised of accelerometers, pressure sensors, and an STM32WB microcontroller
Conducted regression testing for products with Quectel modems

volunteer.summary: Supervised safe practices during the FIRST Robotics Competition Northstar Regional
highlights: Answered student questions about safety and assisted with emergency situations for all 60 teams present
Distributed safety glasses to students in the pits throughout the entirety of competition
Awarded the Safety All-Star to a deserved student each day of the competition

awards.title: Most Valuable Teammate Award and Veteran Inspiration Award
awards.summary: To receive the Most Valuable Teammate Award, students on the TIMEbots robotics team vote for the teammate they think exemplifies the most Gracious Professionalism throughout the season. The Veteran Inspiration Award recipient is a teammate who has been on the team for more than 1 year and selected by the mentors. The award is given to a team member who inspires others to follow the key principles of FIRST Robotics

awards.title: John Philip Sousa Award
awards.awarder: New Prague High School Band Boosters
awards.summary: The award was introduced in 1955 to honor the top student in the high school band. It recognizes superior musicianship and outstanding dedication
